subject: Club members get more of their eToro membership
message:
Become an eToro Club member to activate club features
View Online

Get more out of your eToro membership by joining the eToro Club

Dear Oguzhan,

Have you heard? eToro Club members can enjoy a variety of features when becoming club members. Among others, certain club members can now earn up to 3% annual interest on their available cash balance. 

And you can become one, too!

The rate is different and depends on your Club tier.

Platinum 2% 
Platinum+ 2.5% 
Diamond 3% 

Receiving interest on your balance is just one of the features available to certain eToro Club members, which include your own dedicated Account Manager, access to exclusive data-based Smart Portfolios, and many more.

We would like to give you an opportunity to pick the brain of one of our Account Managers and learn how a Club membership can elevate your eToro experience.

Discover Club Offers

subject: =?UTF-8?Q?Nog_ge=C3=AFnteresseerd_in_de_Volkswagen_Polo=3F?=
message:
Beste Oguz Han,

	Twee weken geleden heb ik contact met je gezocht over de Financial Leaseaanvraag van de Volkswagen Polo met kenteken TV468G. 

	 

	Ben je nog steeds geïnteresseerd? 

	 

	Je kan contact opnemen via 030 267 99 93 of via een Whatsapp-bericht. Als je van gedachten bent veranderd en op zoek bent naar een andere auto, dan sta ik ook voor je klaar.

	 

	Ik hoor graag van je! 

	 

	Met vriendelijke groet,

	 

	Leroy

	 

	Lease Adviseur
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	 
	
	
	 
	
	
	 
Telefoon
030 267 99 93
WhatsApp
​06 25 120 820
E-mail
info@financiallease.nl
Bisonspoor 3002-A301
​3605 LT Maarssen
Postbus 17
​3600 AA Maarssen
www.financiallease.nl
​KVK: 52231119
De inhoud van deze e-mail is vertrouwelijk en kan informatie bevatten die niet voor u bestemd is. Indien deze e-mail kennelijk per vergissing bij u terecht is gekomen, wilt u mij dan a.u.b. direct op de hoogte stellen? U wordt vriendelijk verzocht in dat geval deze e-mail (en eventuele attachments) blijvend te wissen, de inhoud niet te gebruiken of ter kennis van derden te brengen.

subject: You'll be missing out Oguzhan
message:
Is there something holding you back?
People may be worshipping Allah in generations after generations, and you'll be the one getting the reward!
To keep receiving our emails, please add our email address to your contacts, and mark this email as "not spam" and "important". If you don't want to receive more emails from us, please do not mark it as spam, but click the unsubscribe link at the bottom.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
You will get the reward of all those who are:
  • Praying in the Masjid.
  • Listening to the Khutbah.
  • Fasting.
  • ​Converting to Islam.
  • ​Coming closer to Allah.
  • Reading Quran.
  • Learning Arabic.
  • Studying Islam.
  • Becoming Imams.
  • Giving Dawah.
​And so much more!
SubhanAllah!
Become a Monthly Supporter Now Oguzhan, to Get Your Reward!
I want to donate with PayPal instead
Consider this!
You do your best to stay away from Haram, right?

But still, you're not perfect.

I mean, no one is!

We all make mistakes, all the time.

And not only that, let's be real!

Our worship of Allah is nowhere near how good it should be. That goes for all of us. 

So what do we do to compensate?

The Prophet ﷺ said:

"Sadaqah extinguishes sins just as water extinguishes fire."
(Al-Tirmidhi 614)

And he ﷺ said:

"He who calls others to follow the Right Guidance will have a reward equal to the reward of those who follow him…"
(Sahih Muslim Book 34, Hadith 6470)

So what you should do is to:

(1) Give Sadaqah!

(2) Give it to a project that would lead people to follow the guidance of Islam.

Then you'll get double up!

Your sins will be forgiven, and on top of that you'll be rewarded for all the good deeds that other people do as a result of your donation!
Donate Monthly Now to Get Your Reward!
I want to donate with PayPal instead
Is there something holding you back from becoming a monthly supporter?
Allah says (translation of its meaning):

"Satan frightens you with poverty and orders you to do immorality, while Allah promises you forgiveness from Him and bounty. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing."
(Quran 2:268)

You don't have to donate hundreds or thousands dollars if you can't.

You give for the sake of Allah that which is in your capacity.

It can be $10 or even $5 a month.

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Guard yourself from the Hellfire, even with half of a date in charity ...”
(Sahih al-Bukhari 6195)

If you still aren't sure, then let me share some verses of the Quran and Hadiths that may make you change your mind. 

Sometimes we’re afraid of poverty, but we just need to trust Allah.

That's because spending for the sake of Allah doesn't really lead to poverty, rather it's one of the means of increasing one’s provision.

Allah says (translation of its meaning):

“And whatever you spend of anything (in Allah’s Cause), He will replace it. And He is the Best of providers.”
(Quran 34:39)

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“Charity does not in any way decrease the wealth.”
(Sahih Muslim 2588)

And Allah's Messenger ﷺ also said:

“Allah said, 'O son of Adam! Spend, and I shall spend on you.”
(Sahih al-Bukhari 5352)

So don’t fear poverty, rather look at this as a means to come out of poverty.

subject: The Destructive Curse
message:
There is only one quality which is truly FATAL for any man aspiring for greatness.

 

The number one quality which GUARANTEES failure.

 

You could be the most talented man on the planet.

 

God could have blessed you with absolutely every single talent and gift POSSIBLE.

 

And with all these gifts, if you are a quitter?

 

You'll remain BRUTALLY unremarkable.

 

Out of every quality on earth, “quitter” is truly the most destructive.

 

You may be reading this with nearly every curse God could bestow you, short, ugly and poor.

 

As long as you are not a quitter, you're going to be just fine.

 

Understand that the people richer and more successful than you may be much LESS talented than you are.

 

They simply worked much harder than you did.

 

If you worked as hard as they did, you'd be surpassing them.

 

Every world champion had doubts on their climb to greatness and every world champion ignored them.

 

You should feel a deep shame inside of your heart when you quit something.

 

When you don't work hard enough at a chance to become someone great.

 

Life doesn't give you unlimited chances.

 

You do not deserve unlimited chances.

 

Life gives you a few chances, and tests how seriously you dedicate yourself to each one.

 

DO NOT FAIL.

subject: Hold on! You need to have this in your ibadah!
message:
Ramadan Tip 23

If you don’t want these emails, don’t report them as spam, click here and unsubscribe from "Islamic Reminders".

Assalamu alaykum Oguzhan! In sha Allah this email reaches you in the best of health and iman!

Today is the 23rd day of Ramadan, and as we are proceeding towards the end, about one week is remaining of this blessed month.

We hope you are benefitting tremendously from this special time and are rewarded for it. We want to remind you about the importance of ihsan no matter what kind of action we are doing.

Some people might be wondering: What is ihsan, and what does that have to do with Ramadan? Ihsan is a term that includes a variety of similar meanings such as: perfection, goodness, and doing things in the best way possible.

Allah commanded us to have ihsan when He said (translation of the meaning), “Allah enjoins to do justice and to adopt good behavior (ihsan) …” [Quran 16:90]

And when Jibreel asked the Prophet ﷺ about what ihsan is, he ﷺ replied, “Ihsan is to worship Allah as if you see Him, and if you do not achieve this state of devotion, then (take it for granted that) Allah sees you.” [Bukhari 4777]

So we should adopt goodness and perfection to such an extent that our khushoo becomes like we are seeing Allah even though we are not seeing Him, because we know that Allah sees us.

But does ihsan only apply to our ibadah? The truth is that ihsan is such an important concept in Islam that it applies to every single thing that we do, whether it be related to our worship or whether it is related to the affairs of the dunya.

The Prophet ﷺ said, “Verily Allah has enjoined ihsan upon every single thing.” [Muslim 4810]

So how can we utilize ihsan in Ramadan? Whatever you do, try to do it in the best way possible, attaining the level of perfection.

If you are making du’a, make the du’a from your heart.

If you are praying, focus upon concentration and the meanings of whatever you are saying during the prayer.

Before you pray, make sure to do wudhoo in the most efficient way without wasting water.

No matter what you do, remember that ihsan is prescribed in that act, and try your utmost to do it in the best way possible.

May Allah make you and your family amongst the muhsinoon, those people who have perfected their ihsan, and are rewarded enormously for it. Ameen.

Amongst the methods you can use in order to improve your ihsan is to give sadaqah for the sake of Allah.

Try doing that while having the purest intention only for Allah’s sake, and give to the best causes intending to benefit as many people as possible and making it a sadaqah jariyah for you.

The Prophet ﷺ said, “When a man dies, his acts come to an end but three: recurring charity, or knowledge (by which people) benefit, or a pious son who prays for him.” [Muslim 4005]

A recurring charity which you will reap the rewards for even after you return to Allah, is amongst the best types of sadaqah which you can invest in right here and right now.

Just imagine having passed away and not being able to do good deeds anymore, but then your rewards for ongoing charity keeps on coming in to your account. What can be more amazing than that?

We have many ongoing sadaqah jariyah projects which you can benefit from in terms of rewards, and help to grow even further.

In the last years, around 200 Norwegians have found Islam, and uncountable Muslims have come closer to Allah through our da’wah!

That is in addition to all the millions of people we are reaching with our da’wah every year. Just think about how many of those have changed their lives and converted to Islam as well, which we don’t even have a count for.

Imagine getting ongoing rewards for people constantly changing their lives and even entering into Islam, all because of you supporting this project.

Now you have the opportunity to become one of our amazing monthly donors to support this cause and get these amazing rewards.

And if you already are amongst our very special monthly contributors, consider giving an extra one-time donation in order to maximize your rewards even further.

And did you know it’s possible that Laylat al-Qadr is today? It’s best to keep donating every night in the last ten nights of Ramadan to in sha Allah be sure that your sadaqah coincides with this blessed night; which is better than a thousand months.

Actually, it’s better to donate during both the night and the day. The great tabi’i scholar ash-Sha’bi said about Laylat al-Qadr, “Its night is as its day.” [Lata-if al-Ma’arif, 204]

And that’s again part of ihsan; to strive hard both during the night and the day, but to excel even further during the night.

May Allah give you and your family ihsan in every action that you do, and may He accept from you in the blessed month of Ramadan, and enter you all into Jannah. Ameen.

subject: My secret formula for Laylat al-Qadr!
message:
Try it!

If you don’t want these emails, don’t report them as spam, click here and unsubscribe from "Islamic Reminders".

The Prophet ﷺ said:

“… whoever spends the night of Laylat Al-Qadr in prayer out of faith and in the hope of reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.” [Sunan an-Nasa'i 5027]

Let me share with you the formula that you can use to get all of your sins forgiven and earn massive reward!
  • Pray as much as you can, as the prayer includes recitation of the Qur’an, and bowing and prostration to the Almighty Allah.
  • Make tawbah as much as you can, as tawbah forgives the big sins and gives you a fresh start in life.
  • Make du’a as much as you can, as du’a acknowledges your neediness before Allah, and is a means for you to attain what you desire in this life and in the next.
  • Give sadaqah as much as you can, as sadaqah forgives your sins as water extinguishes fire, raises your ranks in Paradise and purifies you from stinginess and ego.
And remember, all of these actions, will in sha Allah be multiplied for you to such an extent that it would require a thousand months, i.e. a whole lifetime of worship of ordinary nights, to reach this level of reward!

But beware! There’s a common mistake many Muslims make in terms of sadaqah! How much should you give?

Praying, du’a and tawbah is given; “I’ll do as much as I can”.

But when it comes to charity, we often tend to hold back, and we don’t act upon the same principal of doing as much as we can.

So that’s the golden rule here, give as much as you can, for there’s no night nor day, better for you to give $1 million in charity (if you’re able to), than Laylat al-Qadr!

And the same applies for initiating the best of deeds in the sight of Allah; continuity in our good actions.

So, if you didn’t do the mentioned ibadahs before, make it your intention to make these acts of worship regular in your life.

So, if you’re not one of our amazing monthly donors, initiate that action right now and sign up as monthly contributor to our Masjid and Dawah center project and ongoing Dawah.

Lastly, whatever you give and strive in this night, I ask Allah to accept it from you and give you the rewards of Laylat al-Qadr; causing your forgiveness and your surpassing in ajr, ameen!
